content: Known as the "Father of the Computer," this English mathematician and inventor created the concept of the programmable computer in the 19th century.

I believe you're referring to Charles Babbage. He is indeed often referred to as the "Father of the Computer" due to his pioneering work in the 19th century on mechanical computers. Babbage's most notable contributions include the design of the Difference Engine and the Analytical Engine, which incorporated features that are fundamental to modern computers, such as punched cards for input and output, and the concept of a central processing unit. His work laid the groundwork for the development of computer science as we know it today.
